sections.title: Further reading

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: This section is for further reading references and does not serve as the lead section of the article where an infobox would be appropriate.
Infoboxes are intended for summarizing key facts at the top of the article, not in a 'Further reading' section which provides additional references.
This requirement is relevant to the top of articles, not for the 'Further reading' section, which is supplementary.
This section does not involve infoboxes; it is focused on additional literature for readers interested in more depth.
The requirement pertains to Infobox protein for family articles, not relevant to the 'Further reading' section.
This requirement relates to nonhuman protein infoboxes, which are not relevant to the literature reference section.
The requirement is specific to protein families listed in Pfam, not applicable to the format and purpose of further reading sections.
Rfam infoboxes are unrelated to the 'Further reading' purpose, which is to guide readers to additional resources, hence not applicable.
The section is for reading references, not for presenting key enzyme information supported by infobox.
Enzyme infobox considerations are not relevant to this section's purpose which focuses on additional reading.
Infobox requirements for Pfam families do not apply to further reading sections focused on additional resources.
There is no use of infoboxes requiring subsection placement as the section is reference-focused.
Since no infoboxes are present in this section, this collapsing consideration is inapplicable.

sections.meta_notes: The 'Further reading' section is appropriately defined for supplemental references and does not require infobox evaluations.
